ratings.comment: Amazing and intellectually stimulating in the Marxist Aesthetics class I took in 1976.

Prospero taught my MA/PhD levels. He is tough, hard thinking and critical. You had to read a lot, do research and think on your own. I learned so much from him; reading lists were broad and profound, involving many languages and traditions. Always loyal to his students and truth/art--unlike others.  He is a brilliant man, teacher and poet-friend.
SERIOUS SEMINARS. ALWAYS WAS AN INVITATION TO THINK AND MEDITATTE IN OUR READINGS. WISH THE BEST FOR PROFE.
THE BEST CLASSES EVER; HELP ME TO UNDERSTAND BETTER THE THINKERS OF THE WESTERN WORLD AND ALSO OUR NATIVE WRITERS SUCH AS CESAR VALLEJO. THANK YOU PROFE.

Dr. Saiz was one of the true scholars I saw as an student and later as a professor.  He was always prepared to teach very difficult materials from the Greek to the French thinkers. Other just were mercenaries with no vocation and very poor  knowledge, they came to the seminars to force the students to agree with them. Thanks Profe!
I had Prospero in the late 70's and he is the coolest...brilliant...I loved his class and still adore him to this day.

He was kind of a rambler.  It would be fun to listen to him speak at a seminar but not as a professor.  The TAs are essentially your professors.  Mine just kind of said yeah... I've got hard grad classes so you all just get a B, is that ok?

This class was a COMPLETE waste of my time.  I learned absolutely nothing and if I had listened to what Prospero said I would have learned less than nothing.  He rambles on about his own unfounded beliefs and takes no one else's perspective into account.  He is completely out of touch with his students and shows no signs of improving.

Prof. Saiz is borderline insane at times. Half of the stuff that comes out of his mouth scared the crap out of me. The reading is classic, but do not take this course if you're carrying a large load for the semester because it gets pretty intense.

His lectures weren't awful but he's pretty out there sometimes.  The papers aren't very difficult to write and all of the ideas they're looking for he says in lecture.  If you take almost word for word notes you'll be able to write all your papers no problem.  TA's are very helpful in this class.

Class lectures are not helpful and seem disorganized, they provide no useful information for assignments. Class is really run by the TA's. In general his ideas seem social anarchist based. Readings are not for the light of heart (or stomach).

This class is horrible. Saiz speaks so fast and so quietly (you have to sit in the front to hear) that it makes your notes messy and unclear. He is pretty scatterbrained so he jumps around with his ideas and never stops speaking, so you dont ever have have enough time to write down complete ideas.
